slide.title: Deviating from Normal ...
slide.p: A few things are different in this course, compared to what you might be used to...

ul.li: Organizer, lessons, tutorials, and lab/assignment writeups all on our course hub.
Material can be viewed as slideshow or webpage, and maybe downloaded as PDF.
Code examples or starter projects all shared as Github repositories, to be forked/downloaded.
Assignments done in teams, on github(?!); readme (with links) is submitted to D2L dropbox

slide.title: GIT Repositories
slide.p: Throughout this lab, and indeed this course, frequent mention is made of "github repositories". The course hub, and *all* of the starter and example projects are stored on github.com.

p.b: This is an off-campus resource, and the BCIT privacy policies apply.

slide.p:
Your work is to be completed in a public GIT repository, but you have choices for this:
Use github.com voluntarily, possibly with an alias account name if you have privacy concerns
Use git.cit.bcit.ca, a Gitlab server on campus
Use a private repo on bitbucket.com or the GIT server of your choice, and add me as a collaborator
Whenever you read the term "github repository" in connection with your work, interpret that as whatever GIT repository you are using!

slide.title: Grading
slide.p: Attendance expected, missing more than 2 labs => U
Labs: individual or varying pairs, rubric-based assessment
Assignments: teams of 3-5, each building on the previous, rubric-based assessment

ul.li: Required proficiency: programming, Java (COMP2526) or C (COMP2510)
Somewhat proficient: O-O programming, O-O analysis and design (patterns!)
Assumed: English, basic math, basic relational database, basic networks, basic algorithms, basic HTML/CSS
